meanings.definition: Teach (a person or group) to accept a set of beliefs uncritically.
meanings.sent1: The teacher indoctrinates the students with the importance of kindness.
meanings.sent2: The cult leader indoctrinates his followers to believe he is infallible.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot indoctrinates the other birds to mimic its phrases.
meanings.sent4: The constant exposure to negativity indoctrinates pessimism into their minds.
meanings.sent5: The catchy jingle indoctrinates people to remember the brand.

meanings.definition: Instruct in a doctrine, principle, ideology, etc., especially to imbue with a specific partisan or biased belief or point of view.
meanings.sent1: The political party indoctrinates its members with its agenda.
meanings.sent2: The extremist group indoctrinates recruits with radical ideologies.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat indoctrinates the kittens to steal treats.
meanings.sent4: The hypnotic rhythm of the music indoctrinates the audience to dance.
meanings.sent5: The persuasive speaker indoctrinates the audience with his charismatic arguments.
